required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Trusopt and Cosopt; Ocular Perfusion Pressure and Blood Flow: New Long-term Prospective Data
clinical_study.official_title: Trusopt and Cosopt; Ocular Perfusion Pressure and Blood Flow: New Long-term Prospective Data

brief_summary.textblock: To analyze Cosopt® in terms of its effects on ocular perfusion pressure and comprehensive ocular blood flow and in relation to visual field progression and optic nerve structural changes in an ongoing 3 year prospective study involving 120 patients with open angle glaucoma.

detailed_description.textblock: To analyze Cosopt® in terms of its effects on ocular perfusion pressure and comprehensive ocular blood flow and in relation to visual field progression and optic nerve structural changes in an ongoing 3 year prospective study involving 120 patients with open angle glaucoma.

primary_outcome.measure: 6-month Change in Ophthalmic Artery (OA) Peak Systolic Velocity (PSV)
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of change in ocular blood flow - ophthalmic artery peak systolic velocity

primary_outcome.measure: 6-month Change inOphthalmic Artery (OA) End Diastolic Velocity (EDV)
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of change in ocular blood flow - ophthalmic artery end diastolic velocity

primary_outcome.measure: 6-month Change in Ophthalmic Artery (OA) Vascular Resistance (RI)
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of change in ocular blood flow - ophthalmic artery resistance index, this is a measure of the amount of resistance to blood flow within the selected blood vessel.

primary_outcome.measure: 6-month Change in Central Retinal Artery (CRA) Peak Systolic Velocity (PSV)
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of change in ocular blood flow - central retinal arteries peak systolic velocity

primary_outcome.measure: 6-month Change in Central Retinal Artery (CRA) End Diastolic Velocity (EDV)
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of change in ocular blood flow - central retinal arteries end diastolic velocity

primary_outcome.measure: 6-month Change in Central Retinal Artery (CRA) Vascular Resistance (RI)
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of change in ocular blood flow - central retinal arteries resistance index, this is a measure of the amount of resistance to blood flow within the selected blood vessel.
Measurement of change in ocular perfusion pressure, the pressure of blood flow to the eye minus the pressure of within the eye.
Measurement of change in ocular blood flow - ophthalmic artery peak systolic velocity
Measurement of change in ocular blood flow - ophthalmic artery end diastolic velocity
Measurement of change in ocular blood flow - ophthalmic artery resistance index
Measurement of change in ocular blood flow - central retinal arteries peak systolic velocity
Measurement of change in ocular blood flow - central retinal arteries end diastolic velocity
Measurement of change in ocular blood flow - central retinal arteries resistance index
Measurement of change in ocular perfusion pressure

intervention.description: We did NOT provide any intervention, we observed groups of patients already on these drugs as observers only.
intervention.other_name: Cosopt is a trade name drug which is a combination of dorzolamide and timolol.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age: 30 years or older.
2. Diagnosis: confirmed open-angle glaucoma in at least one eye:
1. glaucomatous visual field loss on Humphrey 24-2 or 10-2 perimetry
2. glaucomatous optic disc cupping
3. agreement between two baseline exams for reliability
3. Best corrected visual acuity at least 20/60 in at least one eye.
4. Prior Humphrey visual fields demonstrate acceptable reliability standards.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Extensive Humphrey visual field damage consisting of either a mean deviation (MD) < -15 decibels or a clinically determined threat to fixation in both hemifields.
2. Evidence of exfoliation or pigment dispersion.
3. History of acute angle-closure or a narrow, occludable anterior chamber angle by gonioscopy.
4. History of chronic or recurrent inflammatory eye diseases (e.g., scleritis, uveitis).
5. History or signs of intraocular trauma.
6. Severe or potentially progressive retinal disease such as retinal degeneration, diabetic retinopathy, and retinal detachment.
7. Any abnormality preventing reliable applanation tonometry.
8. Current use of any ophthalmic or systemic steroid which may interfere with this investigation.
9. Cataract surgery within the past year.
10. Resting pulse < 50 beats per minute.
11. Severe, unstable or uncontrolled cardiovascular, renal, or pulmonary disease.

facility.name: Indiana University School of Medicine, Department of Ophthalmology

participant_flow.recruitment_details: recruitment over 6 months. Hospital and area eye clinics
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: observational study, patients were treated by their physician not by study personel, treatments/interventions were self-reported by the patients, treatment was not necessarily started at glaucoma diagnosis

group.title: Trusopt
group.description: Patients with glaucoma taking Trusopt or Cosopt alone or with prostaglandin for at least 6 months

group.title: Prostaglandin Alone
group.description: Patients with glaucoma taking prostaglandin alone for at least 6 months

baseline.population: glaucoma patients:There will be (as shown) differences in the number of subjects based upon the time of analysis due to patient loss, data of insufficient quality at visit, or change in the drug use during period of study (patient switched off treatment by their doctor) so the number of data points varies throughout the analysis by availability.

reported_events.desc: Adverse events were not assessed/collected as part of this study protocol.

group.title: Glaucoma Patients
group.description: Patients with Glaucoma

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Small numbers of participants at various time-points limited the power of analysis in our estimation, as did patients who changed medications and therefore further limited analysis options at various time-points.
